intro: Centaurea rigida var. erythracantha, commonly known as the redstem globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. It thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Centaurea rigida var. erythracantha is a perennial herb that is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
